attributes.description: This chain will map out the process of how Kit-Kats are made and where all the resources come from. Kit-kats have been manufactured since 1935, and originated in Rowntree, York of England.
attributes.title: Kit-Kat Supply chain

attributes.description: In Pennsylvania is the second biggest kit-kat producing factory in the world as well as one of two factories to produce kit-kats that are made by Hersheys chocolate.
attributes.title: North American Manufacturing

attributes.description: The hazelnuts that are used in Kit-Kats are for the wafer bars in the chocolate product.
attributes.title: Hazelnut Source

attributes.description: This is the main Kit-Kat factory in the world and most of the Kit-Kats are made in this humongous factory. It was established in the 1920s and has doubled in Kit-Kats made per day since then.
attributes.address: Rowntree Way, Saffron Walden, Essex CB11, UK
attributes.title: Main Kit-Kat English Manufacturing

attributes.description: Venezuela has a big cocoa and milk industry, and due to the cheap labor they buy from this country.
attributes.title: Venezuelan Milk and Cocoa Source

attributes.description: In late July 2012 Kit-Kat opened up its first ever factory that is located in the middle east.
attributes.title: UAE Manufacturing/Shipping

attributes.description: Because of the high demand of Kit-kats in Europe, Kit-Kat opened up a factory in Bulgaria and has met the demands of Europe's chocolate industry.
attributes.title: Bulgarian Manufacturing/Shipping
Ghanaian Cocoa source
attributes.description: Most cocoa in the Kit-Kats come from West Africa because of the cheap labour and mass production of cocoa. Ivory Coast and Ghana are the two countries that have the most to do with production of Cocoa and many cocoa farms in these regions use child labour although Nestlé Kit-Kats have not been directly linked with them.

attributes.title: Colombia Milk Source
attributes.description: Nestlé is the third largest milk buyer in Colombia and 5 million USD a month is spent on milk from this country. Colombia ships this cocoa to Europe.

attributes.title: Indian Milk processing factory/Milk source
attributes.description: Since 1959 Nestlé has had a milk processing factory in this region of India.

attributes.title: Ecuadorian Cocoa source
attributes.description:
Nestlé has been buying cocoa from Ecuador for a long time and it is believed that there are 100,000 families involved in the harvesting of cocoa farms. According to sources, Nestlé bought 4500 tons of cocoa from Ecuador in 2012. Ecuador ships this cocoa to Europe.

The cocoa is used for the chocolate in Kit-kat.

attributes.title: Nigerian Soya bean source
attributes.description: Nestlé has committed to growing soya beans in Nigeria as the cheap labour and perfect climate benefits the company.

attributes.title: Philippines Soya Bean source
attributes.description: In most Asian countries that sell kit-kat, different flavors are employed and some use Soya beans as an ingredient. This soya bean growing region is vital to Kit-Kats in Asia but not in Europe or the Americas.

attributes.title: Chinas Manufacturing/Shipping
attributes.description: China has many Kit-Kat factories and from these factories they are sent out to be sold in stores around this region.

attributes.title: Mongolian Milk source
attributes.description:
In June 6, 2012 Nestlé reached an agreement with the local government of Hulunbeier according to China retail news. It will have more than 2,000 cows that will be producing the milk.
 The milk is collected at one source and then distributed to factories. The milk is used to make the chocolate.

attributes.title: Ivory Coast's Cocoa source
attributes.description: In the Ivory Coast over 18,000 farmers work on giving Nestlé the cocoa that is necessary.

attributes.title: Chinese Milk source
attributes.description: Nestlé buys a lot of milk from this region of China and reportedly has 25,000 milk farmers working with Nestlé. The overall income per day is CHF500,000.

attributes.title: Ecuadorian Cocoa source to UAE Manufacturing/Shipping
